Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2010 08:46PM kj56 wrote:   coolbreeze... thank you so very much for your post...it has helped be so much...i was already thinking of the worst scenrio,and i have not even been diagnosis yet,have until tuesday to see the surgeon.
Posts.Title: BIRADS 4 and terrified!! Jalsmama55 zlota

Posts.Content: kj56 wrote:  i had a routine mamogram,was called back to have another mamogram,then sent for a ultrasound. the radiologist and his nurse came in and started talking about what my options were..i was in shock..never did he say what he saw or what it looked liked like..he just told me to try and see my Gyno.doctor and talk to him so he could get me an appointment with a surgeon. unfortunetaly my doctor was out of town. so i have had no one to talk to..to say the least iam scared,my surgeon app. is not until tuesday, i keep going over how the radiologist acted,never did he saw anything like just too be sure,we need to check it out..never did he say anything encouraging...he said really nothing..and i felt like the nurse was just looking at me with sadness. my mind is going crazy. my question is does the radiologist & nurse already know i have cancer? any help out there?... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: a little worried kj56 kj56

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2010 08:37PM kj56 wrote:   thank you!...leaf..you have sorta set my mind at ease for the time being,so i can function until tuesday. i did hear the nurse say somthing about #4..i was wondering what that meant,according to the chart.upbove i now know..many thanks for your reply...i just kept going on in my mind,why the radiologist acted the way he did...i felt he should have said something instead of this is the way out of the office!...ugh!.it looks like #4 is not so good but not the worst!! thanks
